alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued August 19 at 9:46PM PDT until August 21 at 12:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM SUNDAY TO NOON PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet. Occasional sets to 8 feet, particularly north of Newport Harbor. There is also a slight chance of thunderstorms Sunday. * WHERE...Orange County Beaches. * WHEN...From 8 AM Sunday to noon PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions Strong rip currents and longshore currents. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The support for these large waves will weaken greatly Monday morning, so surf should lower to mostly below 5 feet by noon Monday.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
